intro: Clidemia cursoris subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf clidemia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and disturbed areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
